header.title: Esoteric Extension of Tarot to Develop Supersensory Powers

central_thesis: This lesson explores the application of Tarot Key 18, The Moon, to developing supersensory powers by understanding the Corporeal Intelligence, the organization of the physical body, and the role of subconsciousness in evolution, highlighting that the physical is an expression of spirit and a vehicle for spiritual growth.

structure_content.chapter_title: Introduction to Tarot Key 18 and Corporeal Intelligence
structure_content.summary: Introduces Tarot Key 18 (The Moon) and its Qabalistic assignment to the Corporeal Intelligence, emphasizing its connection to the physical body, organization, and sleep. It posits that the complex organization of the human body implies a vast designing consciousness, accessible through a connection to the Universal Mind.

structure_content.chapter_title: The Role of Subconsciousness and Evolution
structure_content.summary: Discusses how subconsciousness holds the knowledge for maintaining the physical vehicle. It links Key 18 to the zodiacal sign of Pisces and explains the symbolism of the Moon's assignment to the inner planet and subconscious process, viewing evolution as a process occurring on subconscious levels.

structure_content.chapter_title: The Symbolism of The Moon Tarot Card
structure_content.summary: Analyzes the imagery of The Moon card, including the pool (basic consciousness), the crawfish (entry into physical form and development of self-awareness through shells), the wolf (unchanged animal nature), and the dog (human ingenuity adapting nature). The path between wolf and dog symbolizes the evolution of consciousness.

Explains the interconnectedness of self-consciousness, subconsciousness, and superconsciousness as facets of One Consciousness. It challenges the idea of linear causality, suggesting that future intentions from superconsciousness drive present actions, rather than past events causing them.

structure_content.chapter_title: The Physical Body as a Manifestation of Spirit
structure_content.summary: Argues against the rejection of the physical body common in some occult teachings. It asserts that the physical plane is the fruit of the tree of spirit, and the aim is to bring spiritual ideas into manifestation through the physical body, not to escape it. It emphasizes that the physical is an essential part of spirit and a vehicle for spiritual growth.

structure_content.chapter_title: Practical Application: Loving the Physical Vehicle
structure_content.summary: Concludes with a practical instruction to approach the physical world and the body with love. It suggests conversing with the Corporeal Intelligence, sending it love and acceptance, and instructing it to build a more perfected vehicle for higher awareness and understanding, especially before sleep.

key_concepts.definition: The bodily intelligence or consciousness assigned to Tarot Key 18, deeply concerned with the physical vehicle, its organization, and its functioning.
A central theme linked to the physical body, implying an extraordinarily vast consciousness that designs and maintains it, extending to the organization of sleep and renewal processes.

The repository of knowledge for the organization and maintenance of the physical vehicle, and the primary level on which evolution occurs. It is seen as a facet of the One Consciousness, distinct from self-consciousness and superconsciousness.

The process by which consciousness moves from lower to higher states, taking place through physical vehicles and driven by subconscious pressures, ultimately aiming for the full expression of supersensory powers.

The highest level of consciousness, which makes decisions about what is to be expressed, initiating the process that manifests on lower planes. It operates outside of linear time, with past, present, and future existing concurrently.

The teaching that the physical body is not separate from spirit but is an essential part of it, created by God. The aim of spiritual attainment is to manifest spiritual ideas through the physical body, not to escape it.

practical_system.description: The 'practical system' described is less a set of discrete rituals and more a philosophical framework for understanding and interacting with one's own Corporeal Intelligence and physical vehicle. The core practice involves recognizing the body as a divinely organized entity and a manifestation of spirit. The key operative is to approach the physical body and its processes (like sleep) with love, acceptance, and conscious instruction, working in harmony with the subconscious processes that maintain it. The emphasis is on elevating the physical to a 'Temple of the living God' and refining it as a vehicle for higher consciousness.
tools: Tarot Key 18 (The Moon) as a symbolic key for understanding Corporeal Intelligence, organization, and evolution.
Qabalistic correspondences (Hebrew letters, planetary assignments) as interpretive frameworks.
Conscious awareness and intention directed towards the Corporeal Intelligence and the physical vehicle.
rituals: Direct communication and instruction to the Corporeal Intelligence before sleep, sending love and acceptance to encourage the building of a more perfected vehicle for higher awareness.
Viewing the physical world and one's own body through the 'eyes of love'.

relevant_quotes.text: Therefore, there must be something within us that has access to all of the infinite knowledge in the Universal Mind in order for us to be and to act, to organize, to create, to function, and keep the individual parts of ourselves in harmonious interrelationship.
This Key shows us Corporeal Intelligence, the physical organization of consciousness but in a specialized way; it shows us evolution, evolution that takes place through physical vehicles.

The path between the wolf and the dog rises and falls, going from the pool to the mountain in the background. It shows a path trod by feet, shaped by understanding. It shows this in terms of evolution, of consciousness evolving from lower to higher.
In essence, we are taught in the esoteric schools of training that superconsciousness makes a decision as to what it intends to be or to express; then its own substance goes into action.
The events of our lives, one might say, are caused by our future pulling us, rather than by our past pushing us.
The whole aim is to bring the spiritual ideas down into the physical plane, so that they act in and through the physical world and the physical body.
We dare not say that the physical body, or anything physical, is not also pure spirit.

This week practice looking at the physical world with the eyes of love. See your body as the Temple of the living God through which it is growing individualized centers of itself. Before going to sleep at night, talk to your own Corporeal Intelligence. Send it love and acceptance. Gently and lovingly instruct it to begin building a more perfected vehicle for the reception and transmission of ever higher levels of awareness and understanding.

critical_analysis.relevance: This text is highly relevant to practitioners interested in the Qabalistic interpretation of the Tarot, particularly how esoteric correspondences can be applied to understanding the physical body, consciousness, and personal evolution. It offers a unique perspective on the interplay between the physical and spiritual, bridging traditional esoteric concepts with modern psychological and philosophical ideas.
critical_analysis.target_audience: Individuals studying Qabalah, Tarot, esoteric philosophy, and those seeking to develop a more integrated understanding of their physical and spiritual existence. It is particularly suited for advanced students or practitioners who are familiar with basic occult concepts and are looking for deeper insights into consciousness and manifestation.
